Raising my Hopper to B grade
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Raising my Hopper to B grade
By MrPenguinRox on Thursday, June 2, 2011 - 02:52 pm:

My Teddy (Hopper/Mock) is a good pretty solid fighter. We all know that Hoppers do not have hard hitting techniques but I can not for the life of me get the little guy to win B class. Right now his stats are: Lif - 214 , Pow - 277, Int - 213, Ski - 304, Spd - 242, and Def 107. I almost got into a tie with two monsters with two loses but I lost to Gunburn (I usually beat him, I do not know what happened). Any suggestions?

By FatherDeath on Thursday, June 2, 2011 - 05:42 pm:

This may or may not help but when I needed to get a Hopper to B class to unlock Niton/Undine, this is what I did:

I got a Hopper/Dragon, used this method: http://legendcup.com/raisingmethodsmr2.php and trained my Hopper in Ski and Pow only for most of it's life, once it's Ski and Pow got to around 700 I just worked on Lif for the rest of it's life, this got the job done easily, in fact this is the Hopper that got me to 8th rank (Beat one of the Major 4). The little guy died shortly after but like I said, he got the job done, I unlocked Niton, Undine and got to 8th Rank, more than I was hoping for. Good luck.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, June 3, 2011 - 05:44 pm:

Essentially, you need to get two stats (not including Life) higher than you currently have them. I may not be totally accurate here, but, IIRC, 400+ is what you need to through B. That and accurate attacks. Always use your most accurate techs.

By MrPenguinRox on Saturday, June 4, 2011 - 05:18 pm:

Thanks! I ended up training my little Teddy up to over 400 power and 400 skill and got by with the win over the B class. It was a tough fight and I ended up tied with an Ape/Plant but I pulled through lol :P

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, June 4, 2011 - 10:03 pm:

Good work!

By LuckySports on Wednesday, September 14, 2011 - 07:57 am:

I had a Hopper/Tiger that went through the Final 4. Final stats at retirement are

Life - 505
Power - 852
Intel - 317
Skill - 999
Speed - 884
Def - 183

You generally want to concentrate on Skill and Speed/Power.

I dunno what the mock would bring to the table, I've never been a fan of that monster :P
Hoppers has super fast guts regen.. It makes it fairly easy to wittle away at your enemies health, even though you don't have any really-hard hitting techs.

This was my 2nd monster I raised for this play-through.

Also - i picked him up off a CD ^_^ Final Fantasy Tactics.

By TheWindupMan on Friday, April 20, 2012 - 01:43 pm:

Unless I'm mistaken, you only need the Hopper to be IN B class, which means you only need to finish the C class official tournament. Which makes it much easier. I just finished raising a hopper but I totally forgot that the whole point I was raising him was to unlock Undines and Nitons...now he's been combined, so I have to start from square one again. Oh well :/
